GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1968. An autonomous institution financially supported by the State of North Rhine-Westphalia. On November 1, 2007, The University Dortmund (Universität Dortmund) has been renamed as TU Dortmund University (Technische Universität Dortmund)

Divisions.Details: zhb is responsible for the areas of continuing education, teaching and faculty development, foreign languages as well as disability and uni­ver­si­ty studies (DoBuS).

DoKoLL is the central point of contact for all matters pertaining to teacher training. At TU Dort­mund University, prospective teachers receive sound training that is research based and practice related.

DELTA is the world’s only electron storage ring located on a uni­ver­si­ty campus. Here, researchers shed light on the best-kept secrets of nature – the tiniest constituents of matter, atoms, protein chains.
The Faculty of Architecture and Civil Engineering encompasses the two disciplines of Architecture and Urban Design as well as Civil Engineering.
The Faculty of Arts and Sports Science comprises three institutes: the Institute of Sports and Sports Science, the Institute of Music and Musicology, and the Institute of Art and Material Culture.
The Faculty of Business and Economics offers an attractive Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Economics with a variety of possible specializations.
The Faculty of Chemistry and Chemical Biology at TU Dortmund University includes all the major subject areas in the fields of chemistry and chemical biology.

The Faculty of Computer Science at TU Dort­mund University is one of the largest computer science departments nationwide. With a broad spectrum of theoretical, practical and technical computer science.
The Faculty of Cultural Studies encompasses the three subjects of English and American Studies, German Language and Literature, and Journalism.

In addition to a degree program in Education, the Faculty offers a Master’s degree in Ageing Societies as well as courses teaching social pedagogy, psychology, social sciences, and elementary sciences.

The Faculty embraces a variety of major industrial technological areas such as in­for­mation technology, robotics, micro- and nanotechnology, advanced energy systems, automotive electronics, and com­mu­ni­cation networks
The Faculty of Human Sciences and Theology encompasses the Institutes of Protestant Theology and Catholic Theology as well as a joint Institute of Philosophy and Political Science.
The Faculty of Mathematics offers degree programs in Mathematics, Technomathematics, Mathematics and Economics as well as Mathematics for the degree program Teacher Training for all school types.
The Faculty of Mechanical Engineering offers degree programs in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, and Logistics.
The Faculty of Physics offers Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Physics and Medical Physics in addition to Physics for the degree program Teacher Training.
The Faculty of Rehabilitation Sciences is the second largest de­part­ment of special education and rehabilitation in Germany.

The Faculty of Social Sciences founded in April 2020 embraces sociology and other social science fields, including social science didactics as well as the long-established Social Research Center (sfs).
The Faculty of Spatial Planning is the largest uni­ver­si­ty de­part­ment for spatial planning in Europe.
The Faculty of Statistics of TU Dort­mund University is the only stand-alone statistics faculty in German-speaking countries.
